3. Checking the reachability of Rendezvous Points (RP)

{"ops":[{"insert":" 
"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Monitoring Multicast Distribution Tree"},{"insert":"

This Qapp is designed for checking the configuration of multicast and analyzing the performance of it. Various statistics will be collected from your environment.

"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Device Level Statistics:"},{"insert":"
PIM neighbor"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Receiver"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Transmission Rate (packets per second (pps) and kilobits per second (kbp)) "},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Packets forwarded/received"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Multicast Reverse Path Forwarding (RPF) failure"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Interface Level:"},{"insert":"
Packets input / output"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"PIM neighbor"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"IGMP join / leave event"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Required Inputs (from user) :"},{"insert":"
Multicast source IP address "},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Multicast destination IP address "},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"
"}]}
rb_notes.text:
Monitoring Multicast Distribution Tree

This Qapp is designed for checking the configuration of multicast and analyzing the performance of it. Various statistics will be collected from your environment.

Device Level Statistics:
PIM neighbor
Receiver
Transmission Rate (packets per second (pps) and kilobits per second (kbp)) 
Packets forwarded/received
Multicast Reverse Path Forwarding (RPF) failure

Interface Level:
Packets input / output
PIM neighbor
IGMP join / leave event

Required Inputs (from user) :
Multicast source IP address 
Multicast destination IP address

rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Highlighting Multicast Shared Tree"},{"insert":"

Mapping the hops of multicast shared tree and highlighting the multicast roles and configurations.

"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Required Inputs (from user) :"},{"insert":"
	Please select a Qmap or a shared device group.

"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Outputs:"},{"insert":"
	A map which contains the hops of multicast shared tree. The roles (Rendezvous Points (RP), LHR and reporter) and configurations would be highlighted.

"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Related Commands:"},{"insert":"
	The output from the following commands:
	1) Cisco Router, Cisco IOS Switch:
show ip mroute"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"show ip igmp groups"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"<Configuration>"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"
"}]}
rb_notes.text:
Highlighting Multicast Shared Tree

Mapping the hops of multicast shared tree and highlighting the multicast roles and configurations.

Required Inputs (from user) :
	Please select a Qmap or a shared device group.

Outputs:
	A map which contains the hops of multicast shared tree. The roles (Rendezvous Points (RP), LHR and reporter) and configurations would be highlighted.

Related Commands:
	The output from the following commands:
	1) Cisco Router, Cisco IOS Switch:
show ip mroute
show ip igmp groups
<Configuration>

rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":"For a specified shared group, map the shared tree hops and highlight the roles and configuration in map.

"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Input:"},{"insert":"
Source "},{"attributes":{"color":"#888888"},"insert":"(Example: 216.218.254.202)"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Group "},{"attributes":{"color":"#888888"},"insert":"(Example: 224.1.1.1)"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Output:"},{"insert":"
		Highlight items on device level:
			1) Shared Tree Hops
			2) RP
			3) LHR
			4) Reporter
			5) Multicast configuration
"}]}

rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"This runbook will check the configurations of multicast shared tree in four steps."},{"insert":"

"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"1. Checking the current state of multicast tree, status of the neighbors and the forwarding paths of the shared multicast traffic."},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"2. Checking all the current multicast configurations."},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"3. Checking the reachability of all Rendezvous Points (RP) by sending the ICMP (ping)."},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"4. Checking the reachability of the destination multicast address by sending the ICMP traffic (ping) if the problem can be located and resolved via the above 3 steps."},{"attributes":{"align":"justify"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"References: "},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"link":"http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/lan/catalyst3650/software/release/16-2/configuration_guide/b_162_consolidated_3650_cg/b_162_consolidated_3650_cg_chapter_011101.html"},"insert":"Understanding and Troubleshooting PIM sparse mode Problems"},{"insert":"
"}]}
rb_notes.text:
This runbook will check the configurations of multicast shared tree in four steps.

1. Checking the current state of multicast tree, status of the neighbors and the forwarding paths of the shared multicast traffic.
2. Checking all the current multicast configurations.
3. Checking the reachability of all Rendezvous Points (RP) by sending the ICMP (ping).
4. Checking the reachability of the destination multicast address by sending the ICMP traffic (ping) if the problem can be located and resolved via the above 3 steps.

References: 
Understanding and Troubleshooting PIM sparse mode Problems

rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Checking the reachability of Rendezvous Points (RP) "},{"insert":"

This node is designed to check the reachability of all Rendezvous Points (RP) by sending the ICMP message (ping).

"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Related Commands:"},{"insert":"
	The output from the following commands:
	1) Cisco Router, Cisco IOS Switch:
ping {RP's IP address}"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"
"}]}
rb_notes.nodeName: 3. Checking the reachability of Rendezvous Points (RP)
rb_notes.text:
Checking the reachability of Rendezvous Points (RP) 

This node is designed to check the reachability of all Rendezvous Points (RP) by sending the ICMP message (ping).

Related Commands:
	The output from the following commands:
	1) Cisco Router, Cisco IOS Switch:
ping {RP's IP address}

rb_notes.text:
This runbook will check the configurations of multicast shared tree in four steps.

1. Checking the current state of multicast tree, status of the neighbors and the forwarding paths of the shared multicast traffic.
2. Checking all the current multicast configurations.
3. Checking the reachability of all Rendezvous Points (RP) by sending the ICMP (ping).
4. Checking the reachability of the destination multicast address by sending the ICMP traffic (ping) if the problem can be located and resolved via the above 3 steps.

References: 
Understanding and Troubleshooting PIM sparse mode Problems

Monitoring Multicast Distribution Tree

This Qapp is designed for checking the configuration of multicast and analyzing the performance of it. Various statistics will be collected from your environment.

Device Level Statistics:
PIM neighbor
Receiver
Transmission Rate (packets per second (pps) and kilobits per second (kbp)) 
Packets forwarded/received
Multicast Reverse Path Forwarding (RPF) failure

rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":"Use this App to analyze configuration and performance of multicasting, including PIM neighbor count, receiver count, packets forwarded/received, and more.

"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Input:"},{"insert":"
Source "},{"attributes":{"color":"#888888"},"insert":"(Example: 216.218.254.202)"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Group "},{"attributes":{"color":"#888888"},"insert":"(Example: 224.1.1.1)"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Output:"},{"insert":"
		Data unit items on device level:
			1) PIM neighbor count
			2) Receiver count
			3) Rate (including pps and kbps)
			4) Packets forwarded/received
			5) RPF failed packet count

		Data unit items on interface level:
			1) Packets in/out
			2) PIM neighbor count
			3) IGMP joins and leaves count

		Highlight items on device level:
			1) Multicast Tree Hops
"}]}
rb_notes.text:
Use this App to analyze configuration and performance of multicasting, including PIM neighbor count, receiver count, packets forwarded/received, and more.

Input:
Source (Example: 216.218.254.202)
Group (Example: 224.1.1.1)

Output:
		Data unit items on device level:
			1) PIM neighbor count
			2) Receiver count
			3) Rate (including pps and kbps)
			4) Packets forwarded/received
			5) RPF failed packet count

		Data unit items on interface level:
			1) Packets in/out
			2) PIM neighbor count
			3) IGMP joins and leaves count

		Highlight items on device level:
			1) Multicast Tree Hops

rb_notes.text:
Monitoring Multicast Distribution Tree

This Qapp is designed for checking the configuration of multicast and analyzing the performance of it. Various statistics will be collected from your environment.

Device Level Statistics:
PIM neighbor
Receiver
Transmission Rate (packets per second (pps) and kilobits per second (kbp)) 
Packets forwarded/received
Multicast Reverse Path Forwarding (RPF) failure

Interface Level:
Packets input / output
PIM neighbor
IGMP join / leave event

Required Inputs (from user) :
Multicast source IP address 
Multicast destination IP address

rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"This runbook will check the configurations of multicast shared tree in four steps."},{"insert":"

"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"1. Checking the current state of multicast tree, status of the neighbors and the forwarding paths of the shared multicast traffic."},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"2. Checking all the current multicast configurations."},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"3. Checking the reachability of all Rendezvous Points (RP) by sending the ICMP (ping)."},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"4. Checking the reachability of the destination multicast address by sending the ICMP traffic (ping) if the problem can be located and resolved via the above 3 steps."},{"attributes":{"align":"justify"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"References: "},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"link":"http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/lan/catalyst3650/software/release/16-2/configuration_guide/b_162_consolidated_3650_cg/b_162_consolidated_3650_cg_chapter_011101.html"},"insert":"Understanding and Troubleshooting PIM sparse mode Problems"},{"insert":"
"}]}
rb_notes.text:
This runbook will check the configurations of multicast shared tree in four steps.

1. Checking the current state of multicast tree, status of the neighbors and the forwarding paths of the shared multicast traffic.
2. Checking all the current multicast configurations.
3. Checking the reachability of all Rendezvous Points (RP) by sending the ICMP (ping).
4. Checking the reachability of the destination multicast address by sending the ICMP traffic (ping) if the problem can be located and resolved via the above 3 steps.

References: 
Understanding and Troubleshooting PIM sparse mode Problems

rb_notes.nodeName: 3. Checking the reachability of Rendezvous Points (RP)
rb_notes.text:
This node is designed to check the reachability of all Rendezvous Points (RP) by sending the ICMP message (ping).

Related Commands:
		The output from the following commands:
			1) ping {RP's IP address}

rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":"Use this App to analyze configuration and performance of multicasting, including PIM neighbor count, receiver count, packets forwarded/received, and more.

"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Input:"},{"insert":"
Source "},{"attributes":{"color":"#888888"},"insert":"(Example: 216.218.254.202)"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"Group "},{"attributes":{"color":"#888888"},"insert":"(Example: 224.1.1.1)"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Output:"},{"insert":"
		Data unit items on device level:
			1) PIM neighbor count
			2) Receiver count
			3) Rate (including pps and kbps)
			4) Packets forwarded/received
			5) RPF failed packet count

		Data unit items on interface level:
			1) Packets in/out
			2) PIM neighbor count
			3) IGMP joins and leaves count

		Highlight items on device level:
			1) Multicast Tree Hops
"}]}
rb_notes.text:
Use this App to analyze configuration and performance of multicasting, including PIM neighbor count, receiver count, packets forwarded/received, and more.

Input:
Source (Example: 216.218.254.202)
Group (Example: 224.1.1.1)

Output:
		Data unit items on device level:
			1) PIM neighbor count
			2) Receiver count
			3) Rate (including pps and kbps)
			4) Packets forwarded/received
			5) RPF failed packet count

		Data unit items on interface level:
			1) Packets in/out
			2) PIM neighbor count
			3) IGMP joins and leaves count

		Highlight items on device level:
			1) Multicast Tree Hops

rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Highlighting Multicast Shared Tree"},{"insert":"

Mapping the hops of multicast shared tree and highlighting the multicast roles and configurations.

"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Required Inputs (from user) :"},{"insert":"
	Please select a Qmap or a shared device group.

"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Outputs:"},{"insert":"
	A map which contains the hops of multicast shared tree. The roles (Rendezvous Points (RP), LHR and reporter) and configurations would be highlighted.

"},{"attributes":{"color":"#0066cc"},"insert":"Related Commands:"},{"insert":"
	The output from the following commands:
	1) Cisco Router, Cisco IOS Switch:
show ip mroute"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"show ip igmp groups"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"<Configuration>"},{"attributes":{"list":"bullet"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"
"}]}

rb_notes.text:
Use this App to analyze configuration and performance of multicasting, including PIM neighbor count, receiver count, packets forwarded/received, and more.

Input:
Source (Example: 216.218.254.202)
Group (Example: 224.1.1.1)

Output:
		Data unit items on device level:
			1) PIM neighbor count
			2) Receiver count
			3) Rate (including pps and kbps)
			4) Packets forwarded/received
			5) RPF failed packet count

		Data unit items on interface level:
			1) Packets in/out
			2) PIM neighbor count
			3) IGMP joins and leaves count

		Highlight items on device level:
			1) Multicast Tree Hops

rb_notes.text:
Highlighting Multicast Shared Tree

Mapping the hops of multicast shared tree and highlighting the multicast roles and configurations.

Required Inputs (from user) :
	Please select a Qmap or a shared device group.

Outputs:
	A map which contains the hops of multicast shared tree. The roles (Rendezvous Points (RP), LHR and reporter) and configurations would be highlighted.

Related Commands:
	The output from the following commands:
	1) Cisco Router, Cisco IOS Switch:
show ip mroute
show ip igmp groups
<Configuration>

rb_notes.text:
Monitoring Multicast Distribution Tree

This Qapp is designed for checking the configuration of multicast and analyzing the performance of it. Various statistics will be collected from your environment.

Device Level Statistics:
PIM neighbor
Receiver
Transmission Rate (packets per second (pps) and kilobits per second (kbp)) 
Packets forwarded/received
Multicast Reverse Path Forwarding (RPF) failure

Interface Level:
Packets input / output
PIM neighbor
IGMP join / leave event

Required Inputs (from user) :
Multicast source IP address 
Multicast destination IP address

rb_notes.text:
For a specified shared group, map the shared tree hops and highlight the roles and configuration in map.

Input:
Source (Example: 216.218.254.202)
Group (Example: 224.1.1.1)

Output:
		Highlight items on device level:
			1) Shared Tree Hops
			2) RP
			3) LHR
			4) Reporter
			5) Multicast configuration

rb_notes.editor:
{"ops":[{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"This runbook will check the configurations of multicast shared tree in four steps."},{"insert":"

"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"1. Checking the current state of multicast tree, status of the neighbors and the forwarding paths of the shared multicast traffic."},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"2. Checking all the current multicast configurations."},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"3. Checking the reachability of all Rendezvous Points (RP) by sending the ICMP (ping)."},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"4. Checking the reachability of the destination multicast address by sending the ICMP traffic (ping) if the problem can be located and resolved via the above 3 steps."},{"attributes":{"align":"justify"},"insert":"
"},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"font":"arial"},"insert":"References: "},{"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"link":"http://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/lan/catalyst3650/software/release/16-2/configuration_guide/b_162_consolidated_3650_cg/b_162_consolidated_3650_cg_chapter_011101.html"},"insert":"Understanding and Troubleshooting PIM sparse mode Problems"},{"insert":"
"}]}
rb_notes.text:
This runbook will check the configurations of multicast shared tree in four steps.

1. Checking the current state of multicast tree, status of the neighbors and the forwarding paths of the shared multicast traffic.
2. Checking all the current multicast configurations.
3. Checking the reachability of all Rendezvous Points (RP) by sending the ICMP (ping).
4. Checking the reachability of the destination multicast address by sending the ICMP traffic (ping) if the problem can be located and resolved via the above 3 steps.

References: 
Understanding and Troubleshooting PIM sparse mode Problems
